org.jpws.data

Class IOManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.data.IOManager

  • public class IOManager
extends java.lang.Object
    IOManager has two principal functions: A) it regulates access to file IO on a generic level in order to prevent destructive conflicts, and B) it serves as a cache for PWS database files and regulates access to their persistent states (external files). In both cases IOManager prevents conflicts in a model that differentiates between reading and writing access. Writing access demands exclusiveness while reading may share with other parallel reading access.

    The strategy to arrive at its functionality is to implement a proprietary locking mechanism for incoming and outgoing IO-streams and supply subclasses for ContextFile and PwsFile which reorganise IO-functions to check against the locking mechanism.

    In order to function properly IOManager requires the application to use only its ContextFile derivate for purposes of file-IO. This is achieved by various methods of makeLocalContextFile() branding or the generic makeContextFile(ApplicationAdapter, String). The most simple way to secure IOManager functionality is to call getInpuStream(ContextFile) and getOutPutStream(ContextFile) for ANY type of ContextFile. Additional service are the getTemporaryFile() methods which also render access controlled files.

    Author:
    Wolfgang Keller

    • Method Detail

      • getDirectAccessDatabase

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFile getDirectAccessDatabase(org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile f,
                                                                   org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsPassphrase pass)
                                                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                   org.jpws.pwslib.exception.PasswordSafeException
        Returns an open PWS database by directly addressing the underlying file format library and ignoring an already open cached instance of that file. The denoted file is accessed under the assumption that there already exists a persistent state of that database as a file.
        Parameters:
        f - ContextFile identifier for a database
        pass - PwsPassphrase
        Returns:
        the opened original PwsFile object
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any param is undefined
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the specified file was not found or access was denied
        org.jpws.pwslib.exception.InvalidPassphraseException - if file could not be opened with passphrase
        org.jpws.pwslib.exception.ApplicationFailureException - if IO-context does not render an input stream
        java.io.IOException - if an IO-error occurred
        org.jpws.pwslib.exception.PasswordSafeException

      • getOpenDatabase

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFile getOpenDatabase(org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile f,
                                                           org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsPassphrase pass)
                                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                                           org.jpws.pwslib.exception.PasswordSafeException
        Returns an open PWS database corresponding to the parameter context file. This method prefers to return a database from the cache of IOManager; if unavailable the denoted file is opened by use of the parameter passphrase under the assumption that there already exists a persistent state of that database as a file. The returned database may already be in use by some other application task. All operations on the database MUST therefore be synchronised on the returned object.
        Parameters:
        f - ContextFile identifier for a database
        pass -
        Returns:
        the opened, fully operable PwsFile object
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any param is undefined
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the specified file was not found or access was denied
        org.jpws.pwslib.exception.InvalidPassphraseException - if file could not be opened with passphrase
        org.jpws.pwslib.exception.ApplicationFailureException - if IO-context does not render an input stream
        java.io.IOException - if an IO-error occurred
        org.jpws.pwslib.exception.PasswordSafeException

      • getDatabase

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFile getDatabase(org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile f)
        Returns an open PWS database from the cache of IOManager or null if not listed. The returned database may also be in use by some other application task. All operations on the database MUST therefore be synchronised on the returned object.
        Parameters:
        f - ContextFile identifier for a database; may be null
        Returns:
        the opened, fully operable PwsFile object or null if not available

      • hasDatabase

        public static boolean hasDatabase(org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile f)
        Whether the parameter context file denotes a database which is inheld within the IO db-cache.
        Parameters:
        f - ContextFile identifier for a database
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if there is a database with the given resource definition listed in the IO-cache

      • saveRealDatabase

        public static void saveRealDatabase(org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFile db)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    org.jpws.pwslib.exception.ApplicationFailureException
        Saves a database absolutely which was registered before in the IO-Manager's cache. Note that this method does not function if the parameter database has not been registered before into the IO-manager via getRegisteredDatabase() or getOpenDatabase().
        Parameters:
        db - PwsFile database to save
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if db has no persistent state defined
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if db is unknown in cache or not equal to cached instance
        java.io.IOException
        org.jpws.pwslib.exception.ApplicationFailureException

      • saveCopyDatabase

        public static void saveCopyDatabase(org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFile db,
                                    org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile target,
                                    org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsPassphrase pass,
                                    org.jpws.pwslib.global.UUID fileUUID)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    org.jpws.pwslib.exception.ApplicationFailureException
        Creates a copy of a database (absolutely) at a given external place. This method also functions if the parameter database has not been registered before into the IO-manager.
        Parameters:
        db - PwsFile database to copy
        target - ContextFile destination file specification
        pass - PwsPassphrase password used on the copy; may be null in which case the original's password is used
        fileUUID - UUID if not null the copy will assume this UUID value, otherwise keep the existing UUID
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if db has no persistent state defined
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if db is unknown in cache or not equal to cached instance
        java.io.IOException
        org.jpws.pwslib.exception.ApplicationFailureException

      • saveDatabase

        public static void saveDatabase(org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFile db)
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                org.jpws.pwslib.exception.ApplicationFailureException
        Saves a database conditionally which was registered before in the IO-Manager's cache. Other than "saveRealDatabase()", this method performs a save on persistent state only if the given database has no representation in the display manager. Note that this method does not function if the parameter database has not been registered before into the IO-manager via getRegisteredDatabase() or getOpenDatabase().
        Parameters:
        db - PwsFile database to save
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if db has no persistent state defined
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if db is unknown in cache or not equal to cached instance
        java.io.IOException
        org.jpws.pwslib.exception.ApplicationFailureException

      • getRegisteredDatabase

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFile getRegisteredDatabase(org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFile dbf)
                                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to insert the parameter database into the IOManager database cache. This is systematically required for newly created databases! If the database, identified by its context file, is already a member of the cache, nothing is done. Otherwise the parameter database is inserted. In both cases the internal cached instance of dbf is returned (which may be different to the given file).
        Parameters:
        dbf - PwsFile file to register into IOManager cache (file must have a persistent state defined)
        Returns:
        PwsFile the cached version of the given database
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • cacheDatabase

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFile cacheDatabase(org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFile dbf)
        Inserts the parameter database into the IOManager database cache. This is systematically required for newly created databases! If the database, identified by its context file, is already a member of the cache, the existing is replaced by the given one. The internal cached instance of dbf is returned, which may be different to the given file.
        Parameters:
        dbf - PwsFile file to insert into IOManager cache (file must have a persistent state defined)
        Returns:
        PwsFile the cached version of the given database
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if given file has no resource definition

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFile getNewDatabase()
        Returns a new and empty instance of PwsFile in an IO-Manager version of the class (subclass).
        Returns:
        PwsFile empty database

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile makeContextFile(org.jpws.pwslib.persist.ApplicationAdapter adapter,
                                                               java.lang.String filepath)
        Creates a ContextFile from its constituent parameters. Objects returned by this method are enabled for IOManager control of streaming conflicts (i.e. returned objects may throw exceptions of type IOManager.OperationLockedException).
        Parameters:
        adapter -
        filepath -
        Returns:
        ContextFile

      • makeLocalContextFile

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile makeLocalContextFile(java.io.File file)
        Creates a ContextFile in the local file system from a java.io.File parameter. Objects returned by this method are enabled for IOManager control of streaming conflicts (i.e. returned objects may throw exceptions of type IOManager.OperationLockedException). If the parameter is null then null is returned.
        Parameters:
        file - java.io.File; may be null
        Returns:
        ContextFile or null

      • makeLocalContextFile

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile makeLocalContextFile(java.lang.String filepath)
        Creates a ContextFile of the local files context and a file path parameter. Objects returned by this method are enabled for IOManager control of streaming conflicts (i.e. returned objects may throw exceptions of type IOManager.OperationLockedException).
        Parameters:
        filepath -
        Returns:
        ContextFile

      • makeLocalContextFile

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile makeLocalContextFile(java.lang.String parent,
                                                                    java.lang.String child)
        Creates a ContextFile of the local files context and two file path parameters, comprising a parent pathname and a child pathname. Objects returned by this method are enabled for IOManager control of streaming conflicts (i.e. returned objects may throw exceptions of type IOManager.OperationLockedException).
        Parameters:
        parent - String first part pathname (e.g. directory); may be null for ignore
        child - String second part pathname (e.g. filename)
        Returns:
        ContextFile

      • getTemporaryFile

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile getTemporaryFile()
                                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a context file in the local file system which may function as a temporary application file. (Files returned here are NOT automatically removed when IOManager exits.)
        Returns:
        ContextFile definition for a temporary file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getTemporaryFile

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile getTemporaryFile(java.lang.String suffix)
                                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a context file in the local file system which may function as a temporary application file. (Files returned here are NOT automatically removed when IOManager exits.)
        Parameters:
        suffix - String determines the file extention naming of the returned file; may be null in which case ".tmp" is used
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getTemporaryFile

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile getTemporaryFile(java.lang.String suffix,
                                                                java.io.File dir)
                                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a context file in the local file system which may function as a temporary application file. (Files returned here are NOT automatically removed when IOManager exits.)
        Parameters:
        suffix - String determines the file extention naming of the returned file; may be null in which case ".tmp" is used
        dir - target directory (local); may be null for default
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • access_allowed

        public static boolean access_allowed(org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile f,
                                     boolean reading)
        Whether the parameter context file is permitted to perform the given IO-operation. Write access is generally disallowed for open databases.
        Parameters:
        f - ContextFile the external file in question
        reading - boolean true == read access, false == write access
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if the requested operation is permitted
